channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Queen attends Platinum Jubilee equestrian extravaganza
item.description: Hollywood stars including Helen Mirren and Tom Cruise feature in the show at Windsor Castle.

item.title: Full lunar eclipse creates rare super blood Moon
item.description: Its hue was created by sunlight being projected through the Earth's atmosphere onto the Moon.

item.title: GCSE and A-level exam invigilator shortages mean parents and teachers are stepping in
item.description: A union is warning of invigilator shortages as pupils sit their first summer exams since 2019.

item.title: Energy bills shake-up plans to avoid price shocks
item.description: Ofgem says a review every three months would allow households to benefit sooner from falling prices.

item.title: North Korea: More than a million Covid cases feared
item.description: The military has been ordered to intervene as a wave of Covid cases sweeps the unvaccinated country.

item.title: Covid mask rule partially eased for EU air travel
item.description: Masks are no longer required on many EU flights, but countries including Germany, Italy and Spain keep the rule.

item.title: Diesel prices reach record of over £1.80 a litre
item.description: The RAC says prices rose to just over £1.80 a litre after the previous record was set in March.

item.title: Buffalo shooting: Supermarket attack victims' names released
item.description: Ten people were killed in Saturday's attack - described by Buffalo's police chief as a racist hate crime.

item.title: Laura Robson: Former junior Wimbledon champion & Olympic silver medallist retires
item.description: Laura Robson, who won junior Wimbledon at 14 and an Olympic silver medal at 18, confirms her retirement from tennis.

item.title: Ukraine Eurovision win: Presenter hosting from bunker jumps for joy
item.description: Timur Miroshnychenko tells BBC Breakfast he hopes the country will be able to host next year.

item.title: Joseph Wright of Derby painting saved for nation
item.description: Joseph Wright's Self-Portrait at the Age of About Forty is going on permanent public display.

item.title: Paralympic swimmer's bid to cross English Channel
item.description: Melanie Barratt wants to become the first blind woman to cross the English Channel solo.

item.title: The Papers: 'Radiant Queen' and 'PM's gamble risks trade war'
item.description: The papers cover the start of Platinum Jubilee celebrations and look ahead to the PM's Belfast visit.

item.title: Focus on female farmers in Northumberland and the Scottish Borders
item.description: A new portrait exhibition features female farmers across Northumberland and the Scottish Borders.

item.title: Fleeing Syria 10 years on: 'We cried all the way to Jordan'
item.description: A family looks back after a decade living in the world's largest Syrian refugee camp.

item.title: A tale of two femicides - and media bias
item.description: The media covers some murders less than others, but crimes of femicide may at least soon be counted more accurately.

item.title: The new jet set - why private plane usage has soared
item.description: The pandemic led to more people using private jets, but is the increase set to continue?

item.title: Boris Johnson faces knotty diplomatic challenge in Brexit deal talks
item.description: Boris Johnson grapples with a four-dimensional diplomacy dilemma in Northern Ireland.

item.title: GCSE and A-level exams 2022: What you need to know
item.description: For the first time since Covid, students are sitting exams across the UK - so what has changed?

item.title: How Australia became the anxious country
item.description: Australians will vote in an election on Saturday amid much nervousness, writes Nick Bryant.

item.title: Why Urdu language draws ire of India’s right-wing
item.description: The right-wing appears to think the language as a foreign import but history shows quite the opposite.

item.title: Why Shanghai has abandoned its ‘relaxed’ approach to Covid
item.description: Shanghai is now under strict lockdown, in marked contrast to its previous strategy to tackle Covid.

item.title: 'I searched for my sister for 30 years, but Covid took her from me'
item.description: As a child Steve Ellis uncovered a family secret, 60 years later it led to an unexpected friendship.

item.title: 'I had to apply to five banks before I got a loan'
item.description: One firm tells of its struggles as a survey suggests lending to small businesses has hit an all-time low.

item.title: Eurovision 2022: How Sam Ryder turned things around for the UK
item.description: Sam Ryder's song Space Man gave the UK its first top 10 result since 2009. What went right?

item.title: FA Cup winners Chelsea 'will go down in history', says boss Emma Hayes
item.description: Chelsea manager Emma Hayes says her team will go down in history after defending their FA Cup crown and completing the domestic Double.

item.title: Tiger Woods at US PGA: American feeling 'stronger' than at Masters
item.description: Tiger Woods returns to Southern Hills, where he won the 2007 US PGA Championship, feeling "stronger" than during last month's Masters.

item.title: Premier League: What's on the line in the final week of the season?
item.description: With 15 games of the Premier League season left, the title race, battle for Europe and relegation are still on the line. Who needs what?

item.title: Chelsea 3-2 Man City: Watch Erin Cuthbert's FA Cup final stunner from every angle
item.description: Watch Erin Cuthbert's long-range goal in Chelsea's 3-2 FA Cup final win against Manchester City from every angle.

item.title: Brentford's Rico Henry and Ivan Toney say their families were racially abused at Everton
item.description: Everton confirm they are assisting police after two Brentford players said their families were racially abused at Goodison Park.

item.title: Premier League title race: League title harder to win than Champions League - Hasenhuttl
item.description: Winning the Premier League is more difficult than winning the Champions League, says Southampton boss Ralph Hasenhuttl.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: Can Africa replace Russian gas supplies to Europe?
item.description: Europe is desperately seeking alternative sources of gas after Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Eurovision win brings 'incredible happiness' to Ukraine
item.description: Public support helped push Kalush Orchestra and their song Stefania on to win with 631 points.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: What is Nato and how can Finland and Sweden join?
item.description: Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Finland and Sweden have applied to join Nato.

item.title: Ukraine: The spy war within the war
item.description: The expulsion of Russian officials from Western capitals shows how the spy conflict is intensifying.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: Russian chemical attack claim fact-checked
item.description: Moscow has a history of falsely accusing its enemies of attacks that could be defined as war crimes.

item.title: How many Ukrainians have fled their homes and where have they gone?
item.description: The UN says more than 12 million people have fled their homes since the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Ukraine war: Snake Island and battle for control in Black Sea
item.description: This rocky outcrop has been fiercely contested for weeks and has vital strategic importance.

item.title: Ukraine war in maps: Tracking the Russian invasion
item.description: Russian forces making slow progress around Ukraine's eastern Donbas region amid strong Ukrainian resistance.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: Russian soldiers seen killing unarmed civilians
item.description: The incident, captured on video seen by the BBC, is being investigated as a suspected war crime.

item.title: Ukraine war round-up: Carnage at the river and a war crimes trial
item.description: A single Russian battalion reportedly suffers heavy losses and the UK sanctions President Putin's ex-wife.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: Could India cut its defence ties with Russia?
item.description: India has been under pressure to distance itself from Russia over Ukraine, including reducing defence ties.

item.title: How can I offer a UK home to Ukrainian refugees?
item.description: The government has launched two schemes to let Ukrainian refugees come to the UK.
